intro: Glomera triangularis, commonly known as the triangular glomerate, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its triangular-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
